definition: Marquis (highest Han dynasty ducal title meaning lord of 10,000 households)/high nobles
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
a household/door/family
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
surname Hou

sentences.english: The General Lee, in the high and the emperor, not worth talking about 10000 hou.
sentences.chinese: 使李将军，遇高皇帝，万户侯何足道哉。

definition: to have reached the highest official positions
aristocracy
(of a deserving official) to grant his wife a title and make his son heir to his titles
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
outstanding founding minister (title given to reward loyal general or vassal of new dynasty or state)
official ranking/titles and honors
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to evaluate the merit of sth
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
duke (old)/nobleman/gentry
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
to win the championship/(of an emperor) to bestow the title of king on a subject
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
annal/historical record/CL:筆|笔[bi3]
